nearbyList.name: College for Creative Studies- Tim Horton
Henry Ford High School at CCS

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
FOOD EMPLOYEES shall clean their hands and exposed portions of their arms as specified under § 2-301.12 immediately before engaging in FOOD preparation including working with exposed FOOD, clean EQUIPMENT and UTENSILS, and unwrapped SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES (P) and:
(A)     After touching bare human body parts other than clean hands and clean, exposed portions of arms; (P)
(B)     After using the toilet room; (P)
(C)     After caring for or handling SERVICE ANIMALS or aquatic animals as specified in ¶ 2-403.11(B); (P).
(D)     Except as specified in ¶ 2-401.11(B), after coughing, sneezing, using a handkerchief or disposable tissue, using tobacco, eating, or drinking; (P)
(E)     After handling soiled EQUIPMENT or UTENSILS; (P)
(F)     During FOOD preparation, as often as necessary to remove soil and contamination and to prevent cross contamination when changing tasks; (P)
(G)     When switching between working with raw FOOD and working with READY-TO-EAT FOOD; (P)
(H)     Before donning gloves for working with FOOD; (P) and
(I)      After engaging in other activities that contaminate the hands. (P)
violationsByInspectionidList.subProblem: before handling ready to eat foods
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Hands shall be washed with hot water and soap for at least 20 seconds after contamination.
Remove and replace to be in compliance with law.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
A FOOD specified in ¶ 3-501.17(A) or (B) shall be discarded if it:  
    (1) Exceeds the temperature and time combination specified in ¶ 3-501.17(A),              except time that the product is frozen; (P)
    (2) Is in a container or PACKAGE that does not bear a date or day; (P) or
    (3) Is appropriately marked with a date or day that exceeds a temperature and              time combination as specified in ¶ 3-501.17(A). (P)
violationsByInspectionidList.itemDescription: Ready to eat, potentially hazardous food(s)

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: FOOD shall be safe, unADULTERATED and honestly presented. (P)

(A) EQUIPMENT FOOD-CONTACT SURFACES and UTENSILS shall be clean to sight and touch. (Pf)
(B) The FOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of cooking EQUIPMENT and pans shall be kept free of encrusted grease deposits and other soil accumulations. 
(C) NonFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of EQUIPMENT shall be kept free of an accumulation of dust, dirt, FOOD residue, and other debris.

(A)  READY-TO-EAT, POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS FOOD (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL FOR SAFETY FOOD)  prepared and held refrigerated for more than 24 hours in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT  shall be clearly marked at the time of preparation to indicate the date or day by which the FOOD shall be consumed. (Pf)
(B)  A container of refrigerated, commercially prepared READY-TO-EAT POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS FOOD (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL FOR SAFETY FOOD)  shall be clearly marked, at the time the original container is opened in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT, to indicate the date or day by which the FOOD shall be consumed. (Pf)

A date marking system that does not exceed 7 days, including date of preparation, or opening is to be used. (Pf)
violationsByInspectionidList.itemDescription: In house prepared ready-to-eat potentially hazardous  food(s)

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: The PERSON IN CHARGE shall ensure that employees, practices and policies are in compliance with the code. (Pf)
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Person-in-charge must ensure compliance with items listed above.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: NonFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at a frequency necessary to preclude accumulation of soil residues.
Ventilation hood systems and devices shall be sufficient in number and capacity to prevent grease or condensation from collecting on walls and ceilings.

A WAREWASHING machine; the compartments of sinks, basins, or  other receptacles used for washing and rinsing EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, or raw FOODS, or laundering wiping cloths; and drainboards or other EQUIPMENT used to substitute for drainboards shall be cleaned as required.
EQUIPMENT shall be maintained in a state of repair and condition that meets the requirements of the code.
